result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrus Anthony-Lanell Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Defendant to report by 10-25-2022 for Probation Intake and DNA collection.

miscConds.notes:
No further violations of the law.
No use or possession an any firearms or dangerous weapons.
Full time work, school or a combination.

Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrus Anthony-Lanell Ward

records.addlTxt:
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea. Hearing proceeded. Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1 as Amended : Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

Defendant ordered to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served, Huber privileges for work. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- No further violations of the law.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- No use or possession an any firearms or dangerous weapons. 
- Complete firearm safety course.
- 20 hours community service. 
- Cognitive behavioral therapy program. 
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation. Any unpaid amount results in a civil judgment. 

Defendant to report by 10-25-2022 for Probation Intake and DNA collection.
Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation. 
Appeal rights given.

Defendant Tyrus Anthony-Lanell Ward in court.  Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court for Tyrus Anthony-Lanell Ward.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
On state's motion, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct with Use of Dangerous Weapon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.63(1)(a), a Class B Misdemeanor.

Defendant Tyrus Anthony-Lanell Ward in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel was recently retained and still needs offer and discovery.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Tyrus Anthony-Lanell Ward in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Case in court for Status Conference.   
Defense counsel recently retained and awaiting discovery and offer in this case.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case calendared for a Status on 6-14-2022 at 5:30pm.  Scheduled time calendared in error. Court is in trial and ordered matter adjourned.
Defendant informed via telephone this case will be adjourned.  Status Conference scheduled July 1, 2022 at 1:30pm.

Defendant Tyrus Anthony-Lanell Ward in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case calendared for a Pretrial Conference.
Defendant does not qualify for a state public defender. Court held colluqy with defendant to determine eligibility for a court appointed attorney
Defendant request time to hire private counsel. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 for a status of counsel. 
This hearing will be held  In person, Room 623 of the Courthouse. 
  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 05:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tyrus Anthony-Lanell Ward in court.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/02/2022@02:00pm
